channel.title: Gregory Yob on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Do next?
item.description: When I first used computer systems, there were a lot more user interfaces that felt like {{% key “adventure games” %}}. You’d be presented with a prompt, and the rest of the user interface would be largely concealed. It would be up to you to deduce a proper function of the system by trying all of the plausible responses to the prompt - including “help” or “?”, which might work but you would never really know until you tried them.
